message.content:
cs.DM, cs.DS, cs.GT, cs.CG, cs.SI

Reasoning: The paper deals with the concepts of dominating sets and connected dominating sets in graphs, which are central topics in the subfields of discrete mathematics and theoretical computer science. The graphs under consideration are restricted to those without long paths and cycles, which suggests a focus on structural properties and forbidden subgraphs. Therefore, the most likely sub-categories are cs.DM (Discrete Mathematics), cs.DS (Data Structures and Algorithms), and cs.GT (Computer Science and Game Theory). Additionally, the paper involves some computational aspects, such as the complexity of finding connected dominating sets, which could place it in the sub-categories cs.CG (Computational Geometry) or cs.SI (Social and Information Networks).
